page.title: 01The Great Gonerby Area
page.content: Great Gonerby is recorded in the original Domesday Survey. It looks over the Vale of Belvoir and stands on the summit of a hill on the old Great North Road. The village is now bypassed by the A1 trunk road There are four large farms the majority of residents work in nearby Grantham, or commute to Notthingham or London. Gonerby Hill Foot is mainly residential, apart from a food processing factory and Cash and Carry food sales warehouse. Barrowby stands on rising ground betwen Grantha and the Lincolnshire Notthinghamshire boundary. The parish is bounded by the A52 road to the north and the A1 to the east giving good transport links to the whole Midland area.
